ProjectDescr.Title: The study of identifying function and pathogenesis in respiratory system disease of WFDC2
ProjectDescr.Description: Whole exome sequencing (WES) analysis of a patient with lung disease identified a recurrent mutation (p.Cys97Trp) in the WFDC2 gene. To investigate the molecular mechanisms by which this WFDC2 mutation affects lung function in vivo, we plan to conduct studies using WT (Wild-Type), KI (Knock-In), and KO (Knock-Out) mouse models. This study aims to elucidate the role of WFDC2, identify phenotypic abnormalities associated with the mutation-induced lung dysfunction, and establish a foundation for functional studies and therapeutic development. By uncovering the pathogenic mechanisms of the WFDC2 gene mutation (p.Cys97Trp), we seek to develop an effective model for drug discovery and evaluation of therapeutic interventions.

Grant.Title: Chronic Intractable Disease Systems Medicine Research Center
